thai_script: กระทิงแดง
description: An energy drink and the origin of Red Bull .

thai_script: กระยาสารท
description: Wafers or chunks of rice candy with beans and sesame. Often prepared as an offering to the monks .

thai_script: กระเพราหมูป่า
english_name: Stir-fried Wild Boar with Holy Basil
description: A spicy stir-fry of wild boar meat with holy basil, chili, and garlic, known for its bold flavors.

thai_script: กระเพราไก่,หมู
english_name: Stir-fried Chicken or Pork with Holy Basil
description: A classic Thai dish of chicken or pork stir-fried with holy basil, chili, and garlic, served over rice.

thai_script: กระเพาะปลาน้ำแดง
description: A savory soup made with fish maw stewed in a thick red-brown sauce with mushrooms and seasonings.

thai_script: กระเพาะปลาผัดกุ้ง
description: Fish maw stir-fried with shrimp, vegetables, and light seasonings for a chewy and savory dish.

thai_script: กระเพาะปลาผัดแห้ง
description: Fish maw stir-fried without broth, cooked with vegetables, soy sauce, and garlic for a savory and chewy texture.

thai_script: กล้วยทอด
description: Deep-fried bananas in a light batter.

thai_script: กวยจั๊บ
description: Originally a Teochew Chinese dish ( Chinese : 粿汁 ), it is a soup of pork broth with rolled up rice noodle sheets (resulting in rolls about the size of Italian penne), pork intestines, "blood tofu", and boiled egg.

thai_script: กะหรี่ปั๊บ
description: In Thailand, Karipap is a popular street food snack that is commonly made by using spring roll wrappers. The filling contains chicken, potato, onion and curry powder. These flat and triangle shaped snacks are derived from the Indian samosas .

thai_script: กะหล่ำปลีผัดน้ำปลา
description: A simple yet flavorful stir-fry of cabbage with garlic and fish sauce, often served as a side dish.

thai_script: กะเพราปลาทอด
english_name: Stir-fried Fried Fish with Holy Basil
description: Crispy fried fish stir-fried with holy basil, garlic, and chili for a fragrant and spicy dish.

thai_script: กะเพราหมูสับ/ไก่สับ
english_name: Stir-fried Minced Pork or Chicken with Holy Basil
description: A classic Thai street food made with minced pork or chicken stir-fried with holy basil, chili, and garlic.

thai_script: กะเพราหอยลาย
english_name: Stir-fried baby clams with thai holy basil
description: Undulated surf clam stir-fried with holy basil ( Ocimum tenuiflorum )

thai_script: กาแฟโบราณ
description: Kafae boran literally translates to "ancient/traditional coffee". It is a strong coffee that is served with sweetened condensed milk , similar in taste to the kopi that is served at kopi tiam (traditional coffee shops) of Malaysia and Singapore. It is usually made with robusta coffee beans, by steeping the grounds inside a brewing "sock".

thai_script: กุ้งกระเบื้องโรยงา
description: Minced shrimp spread on crispy bread squares, topped with sesame seeds, and deep-fried until golden.

thai_script: กุ้งคั่วพริกเกลือ
description: Juicy shrimp wok-fried with garlic, chili, and salt for a spicy, savory flavor.

thai_script: กุ้งซอสครีมมะนาว
description: Tender shrimp coated in a creamy lemon sauce that balances richness with citrus freshness.

thai_script: กุ้งทอดกระเทียม
description: Shrimp fried until golden and tossed with crispy garlic for a fragrant and savory dish.

thai_script: กุ้งทอดกระเทียมพริกไทย
english_name: Deep fried prawns with garlic and pepper
description: Prawns fried with garlic and fresh peppercorns.

thai_script: กุ้งทอดซอสมะขาม
description: Crispy fried shrimp topped with a sweet and tangy tamarind sauce, garnished with fried shallots and chilies.

thai_script: กุ้งผัดกะปิ
description: Shrimp stir-fried with aromatic shrimp paste, chili, and herbs for a bold and savory flavor.

thai_script: กุ้งผัดเม็ดมะม่วง
description: A savory stir-fry of shrimp with crunchy cashew nuts, onions, and dried chili in a sweet-salty sauce.

thai_script: กุ้งย่าง/กุ้งเผา
description: Grilled prawns are normally served with a nam chim , a spicy dipping sauce, made with mashed raw garlic and green bird's eye chili peppers, sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice.

thai_script: กุ้งอบวุ้นเส้น
description: Shrimp baked with glass noodles, soy sauce, ginger, and herbs in a clay pot, giving it a fragrant and savory flavor.

thai_script: กุ้งอบวุ้นเส้นหม้อ
description: A larger clay pot version of baked shrimp with glass noodles, cooked with soy sauce, pepper, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: กุ้งเต้น
description: A yam-style salad made with raw, and often still alive and "dancing", freshwater shrimp . Shrimp of the species Macrobrachium lanchesteri are often used. [ 3 ]

thai_script: กุ้งแช่น้ำปลา
description: A Thai salad made from fresh raw shrimp soaked in Thai fish sauce and served with sliced bitter gourd , mint, and a spicy sauce made with raw garlic, chillies, lime juice, sugar, and fresh cilantro/coriander.

thai_script: กุ้งโรล
description: Shrimp wrapped in a crispy pastry roll and deep-fried until golden, served with sweet chili sauce.

thai_script: กุ้งโสร่ง
description: Deep fried prawns wrapped in egg noodles.

thai_script: ก้อยปลา
description: Minced or finely chopped raw fish in spicy salad dressing. It is a popular raw fish dish in Isan and a common source of infection with Opisthorchis viverrini (Southeast Asian liver fluke ).

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวคั่วไก่
description: Wide rice noodles stir-fried with chicken, egg, and soy sauce, often served with lettuce and chili sauce.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวน้ำ
description: A soup of wide rice noodles , often with minced pork, pork balls or fish balls .

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวผัดขี้เมา
description: Spicy fried wide rice noodles.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวราดหน้า
description: Fried wide rice noodles with beef, pork, chicken, or seafood in a thickened gravy.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวเนื้อเปื่อย
description: A beef noodle soup with slices of very tender beef ( nuea pueay ).

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวเรือ
description: Rice noodles with beef or pork (and sometimes offal) in a brown broth which contains cinnamon , star anise and sometimes blood. It is spicy and sour.

thai_script: ขนมกุยช่าย
description: Originally a dish of the Teochew people called "gu chai gue" (Chinese script: 韭菜馃) in the Teochew language , these are steamed dumplings made from rice powder and a filling of garlic chives . The dipping sauce for this dish is soy sauce which often is spiced with dried chili flakes. This particular version was fried to give it a crispy texture.

thai_script: ขนมครก
description: Small coconut hotcakes with different fillings. These are made on a special cast-iron pan with indentations. Two-halves are eventually stuck to one another to form the finished miniature pancake. [ 7 ]

thai_script: ขนมจีนซาวน้ำ
description: Cold rice noodles served as a salad with thick coconut milk, finely chopped pineapple, sliced raw garlic and Thai chili peppers, pounded dried prawns, shredded ginger, lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar.

thai_script: ขนมจีนน้ำยา
description: Thai rice noodles served with a fish based sauce called nam ya .

thai_script: ขนมจีนน้ำเงี้ยว
description: A speciality of Northern Thailand, it is Thai fermented rice noodles served with pork or chicken blood tofu in a sauce made with pork broth and tomato, crushed fried dry chili peppers, pork blood, dry fermented soy bean, and dried red kapok flowers.

thai_name: Khanom chin kaeng khiao wan kai
thai_script: ขนมจีนแกงเขียวหวานไก่
english_name: Khanom chin kaeng khiao wan kai
description: This noodle dish consists of green chicken curry served over khanom chin , fresh Thai rice noodles. It is usually accompanied by a selection of raw vegetables and herbs on the side. The chicken meat used in this particular version is chicken feet .

thai_script: ขนมจีบ
description: The Thai version of the Chinese steamed dumplings called siu mai in Cantonese . The color indicates the filling: the green dumplings contain a mix of minced pork and crab meat, the others have a filling of only minced pork.

thai_script: ขนมชั้น
description: A multi-colored pudding of layers of sticky rice flour and tapioca flour mixed with coconut milk and sugar. Each layer will be differently scented ( pandan , jasmine and more). It is similar to the Indonesian, Malaysian and Singaporean kueh lapis .

thai_script: ขนมตะโก้
description: Jasmine scented coconut pudding set in cups of fragrant pandan leaf.

thai_script: ขนมตะโก้เผือก
description: Traditional sweets made with coconut milk, rice, flour, sugar, and boiled taro pieces in a banana leaf cone.

thai_script: ขนมตาล
description: Palm flavoured miniature cake with shredded coconut on top.

thai_script: ขนมต้ม
description: These sweets are made by boiling balls of dough made from glutinous rice powder, coconut cream, grated coconut, sugar, and flavorings. Then they are covered with more grated coconut.

thai_script: ขนมถ้วยตะไล
description: Steamed sweet coconut jelly and cream.

thai_script: ขนมบัวลอย
description: Taro root mixed with flour into balls and served in coconut milk.

thai_script: ขนมฝรั่งกุฎีจีน
description: Small muffins. The main ingredients are duck eggs, sugar and wheat flour. No butter, milk or yeast. No preservatives. The little cakes are topped with raisins, gourds dipped in syrup, and persimmon. [ 6 ]

thai_script: ขนมวุ้น
description: These are desserts made with an agar gelatin and the colors represent different flavors.

thai_script: ขนมหม้อแกง
description: A sweet baked pudding containing coconut milk, eggs, palm sugar, and flour, sprinkled with sweet fried onions.

thai_script: ขนมเปียกปูน
description: The unique smoky flavor and the deep black color comes from coconut ash. It is made from a mix of sticky rice flour and tapioca flour , together with coconut milk and sugar.

thai_script: ขนมโตเกียว
description: Literally translated it means "Tokyo cake", it is a Thai style crêpe wrapped around a hot dog and sweet chili sauce. The chili sauce can also be served on the side as a dip. Other versions of khanom Tokiao use yam or sweet condensed milk as a filling.

thai_script: ข่เจียว
description: A fluffy Thai-style omelette, deep-fried until golden and crispy, commonly eaten with rice and chili sauce.

thai_script: ข้าวกั๊นจิ๊น
description: A dish of the Tai Yai ( Shan people ) of Myanmar and northern Thailand, it is rice that is mixed with pork blood and steamed inside a banana leaf. Khao kan chin is served with cucumber, onions and fried, dried chili peppers.

thai_script: ข้าวขาหมู
description: Steamed rice is served with sliced pig's trotters , which has been simmered in soy sauce and five spice powder . It is always served with a sweet spicy dipping sauce, fresh bird's eye chili peppers and cloves of garlic on the side. Boiled egg and a clear broth on the side are optional.

thai_script: ข้าวขาหมูไก่
english_name: Stewed Pork Leg with Chicken on Rice
description: A hearty rice dish topped with braised pork leg and chicken, served with pickled mustard greens and garlic-chili sauce.

thai_script: ข้าวคลุกกะปิ
description: Rice is fried with shrimp paste and served with sweet pork, sour mango, fried shrimp, chili peppers, and shallots.

thai_script: ข้าวจาน
description: A general serving of rice presented on a plate, often accompanied by various side dishes or curries.

thai_script: ข้าวซอย
description: Boiled as well as crispy fried egg noodles ( bami ) are served in a curry soup. The version with chicken is called khao soi kai , with beef it is called khao soi nuea .

thai_script: ข้าวซอยน้อยทรงเครื่อง
description: Colloquially also known as pizza doi (Thai: พิซซาดอย, literally: "mountain pizza"). This is a dish of Shan people . This version uses steamed egg and vegetables as the filling for the steamed rice wrap. The whole is dusted with crushed peanuts.

thai_script: ข้าวซอยน้ำหน้า
description: Somewhat similar to khao soi Mae Sai , this variant from the eastern part of Chiang Rai Province is made with wide rice noodles in a clear pork broth. A spoonful of nam phrik ong (a sauce made from minced pork, tomato, fermented soy bean or shrimp paste, and dried chili peppers) is heaped on top of the noodles ( nam na literally means "with sauce on top").

thai_script: ข้าวซอยแม่สาย
description: Khao soi Mae Sai is the name in Chiang Mai of a certain type of khao soi that is more common in Chiang Rai province , in the area along the border with Burma and Laos ( Mae Sai is a border town in Chiang Rai province). It is a spicy soup-like dish, similar to the broth used in khanom chin nam ngiao , containing soft, wide rice noodles, pork ribs, congealed pork blood, and minced pork. Tomatoes and fermented soy bean give it its specific taste. Sliced raw cabbage and bean sprouts are served on the side.

thai_script: ข้าวต้ม
description: Boiled rice in a light broth, usually with minced pork, chicken, or fish. It is often eaten for breakfast.

thai_script: ข้าวต้มกุ๊ย
description: Plain rice is cooked to a porridge and eaten as the staple together with a variety of side dishes.

thai_script: ข้าวต้มมัด
description: The dish is made by wrapping sweet banana and sticky rice inside a banana leaf and then steaming it. The banana takes on a pink color after steaming.

thai_script: ข้าวผัด
description: Fried rice in Thailand can be made with different ingredients. Customarily served with fresh lime, cucumber, spring onions, and nam pla phrik (chili peppers in fish sauce).

thai_script: ข้าวผัดกะเพราหมู
description: Rice fried with a certain variety of Thai basil called kaphrao ( Ocimum tenuiflorum ), sliced pork, and chili peppers.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดกุ้งจานใหญ่
english_name: Large Plate of Shrimp Fried Rice
description: A generous portion of fried rice stir-fried with shrimp, egg, and vegetables, seasoned with soy sauce and garlic.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดน้ำพริกนรก
description: The name literally means "rice fried with chili paste from hell". The rice is fried with nam phrik narok , a very spicy chili paste made with fried catfish, grilled onion and garlic, grilled (dried) chili peppers, sugar, fish sauce, and shrimp paste. Here it is served with mu yang (grilled pork) and nam chim chaeo , a spicy dipping sauce.

thai_name: Khao phat nam phrik long ruea
thai_script: ข้าวผัดน้ำพริกลงเรือ
english_name: Khao phat nam phrik long ruea
description: Rice fried with Nam phrik long ruea (lit. "boat journey chili paste") and pieces of khai khem (salted duck's eggs). Fried, sliced, sweet Chinese sausage called kun chiang ( Thai : กุนเชียง ) are also served here with some sliced cucumber on the side.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดปู
description: Thai-style fried rice stir-fried with sweet crab meat, egg, and scallions, often served with lime and cucumber.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดหนำเลี้ยบ
description: Rice fried with nam liap , the fruit of the Canarium album , also known as "Chinese olives".

thai_script: ข้าวผัดอเมริกัน
description: American fried rice is rice fried with onion, tomato, raisins, and flavored with ketchup. It is often garnished with some sausage, fried chicken, and egg.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดแกงเขียวหวาน
description: Rice fried with green curry.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดไก่
description: Fried rice stir-fried with chicken, egg, and vegetables, seasoned with soy sauce and garlic for a savory flavor.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดไก่,หมู
description: A classic fried rice dish cooked with either chicken or pork, mixed with egg, scallions, and light seasonings.

thai_script: ข้าวพันงาม้วน
description: Rolled khao phan with sesame seeds. Khao phan is a specialty from Uttaradit province. Rice flour is mixed with water and let to ferment overnight. The resulting batter is then spread out thinly over a cloth stretched out over a steamer, covered with a hood and let to steam for a few minutes. Rolled up it is served with a chili dip.

thai_script: ข้าวพันผัก
description: Khao phan are thin, steamed rice sheets made from the fermented batter of rice flour mixed with water. Here it is served as a wrap for stir-fried vegetables.

thai_script: ข้าวมันไก่
description: Rice steamed with garlic served with sliced chicken, chicken broth, and a spicy dipping sauce. This is a Thai version of a dish called Wenchang chicken (文昌雞) from Hainan in southern China.

thai_script: ข้าวยำ
description: A type of Thai rice salad. Here it is shown unmixed, as served at a southern Thai eatery in Korat. This particular version used pomelo, bean sprouts, lime leaves, and toasted coconut flakes, and dried shrimp flakes with the rice.

thai_script: ข้าวหน้าเป็ด
description: Boiled rice with roast duck and duck broth on the side. It is served with sliced chili peppers in soy sauce as a condiment.

thai_script: ข้าวหมกเนื้อ
description: The Thai version of a "beef biryani".

thai_script: ข้าวหมกไก่
description: The Thai version of a "chicken biryani". The name literally means "rice covered chicken" and this Thai-Muslim dish is made by cooking rice together with the chicken curry.

thai_script: ข้าวหมูกรอบ
description: Rice and crispy pork that is often, as here in this image, served with boiled egg and a bowl of broth. The sauce that always comes with khao mu krop is here served separately in the bowl at the top of the image.

thai_script: ข้าวหมูกรอบหมูแดง
english_name: Mixed crispy pork and red roast pork on rice
description: Slices of mu krop (crispy pork) and mu daeng ( red roast pork ) served on rice, and often covered with a sticky soy or oyster-sauce based sauce. Very often, a clear soup, boiled egg, cucumber, and spring onion is served on the side. Sliced chili peppers in Chinese black vinegar and dark soy sauce are provided as a condiment for this dish.

thai_script: ข้าวเนื้ออบ
description: Rice with slices of baked beef, served with a spicy chili dip.

thai_script: ข้าวเหนียว
description: Khao niao is traditionally eaten using only the right hand. It is the staple food of Northern and Northeastern Thais.

thai_script: ข้าวเหนียวมะม่วง
description: Sticky rice cooked in sweetened thick coconut milk, served with slices of ripe mango. [ 2 ]

thai_script: ข้าวเหนียวสังขยา
description: Sticky rice served with an egg and coconut custard ( coconut jam ).

thai_script: ข้าวไข่เจียว
description: A quick snack or breakfast, it is an omelette with white rice, often eaten with chili sauce and cucumber. The variant shown in the image is khao khai chiao songkhrueang ( Thai : ข้าวไข่เจียวทรงเครื่อง ) where the omelette is topped with a minced pork and vegetable stir-fry.

thai_script: ข้าวไข่เจียวหมูสับ
english_name: Omelette with Minced Pork on Rice
description: A fluffy Thai omelette mixed with minced pork, served over steamed jasmine rice. A common and comforting street food dish.

thai_script: คอยหมูย่าง จิ้มแจ่ว
english_name: Grilled Pork with Spicy Dipping Sauce
description: Slices of marinated pork, grilled until tender and smoky, served with a northeastern Thai dipping sauce (nam jim jaew) made of roasted rice powder, chili, and lime.

thai_script: คอหมูย่างกระทะร้อน
description: Kho mu yang kratha ron literally translates to "pork neck grilled on a hot skillet".

thai_script: คะน้าน้ำมันหอย
english_name: Stir-fried Chinese Kale with Oyster Sauce
description: Fresh Chinese kale stir-fried with oyster sauce and garlic, a simple and savory Thai side dish.

thai_script: คะน้าปลาเค็ม
description: Chinese kale stir-fried with pieces of salted fish, creating a salty, aromatic flavor popular in Thai home cooking.

thai_script: คะน้าไฮโดรผัดกุ้ง
description: Crisp hydroponic kale stir-fried with shrimp, combining freshness with the sweet taste of seafood.

thai_script: คะน้าไฮโดรหมูกรอบ
description: Hydroponic kale stir-fried with crispy pork belly, balancing crunchy vegetables with rich, savory pork.

thai_script: คั่วกระดูกหมู
description: A very spicy and, for Thai standards, "dry" curry with pork ribs and it is a Southern Thai speciality.

thai_script: คั่วกลิ้ง
description: A very spicy, dry fried curry made with chopped meat (usually beef, chicken, pork, or lamb) served with a large amount of shredded fresh kaffir lime leaves.

thai_script: คั่วจิ๊นส้มใส่ไข่
description: Northern Thai pickled pork stir-fried with egg.

thai_script: คั่วหน่อไม้ใส่หมู
description: Stir-fried bamboo shoots with pork. In this particular version, the pork is minced.

thai_script: คั่วห่อ
description: Glass noodles are stir-fried with left-overs from other dishes. Unlike kaeng ho , this dish will not contain any left-over curry dishes. It was traditionally eaten at the end of a ceremony or festival. It is served here with pork rinds.

thai_script: จิ้งหรีดทอด
description: Deep-fried crickets , either Gryllus bimaculatus or, as shown in the image, Acheta domesticus . This dish is often eaten as a snack to go with drinks.

thai_script: จิ้มจุ่ม
description: A Thai style hot pot served in an earthenware pot where the ingredients (meats, vegetables, mushrooms, noodles) are cooked in a clear herb broth of lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. Additionally, the broth can contain other herbs such as kaphrao ( Thai holy basil ), spices such as chillies, or in addition be partially meat based, using pork ribs for instance as one of the base ingredients. It is served with one or more nam chim (dipping sauces).

thai_script: จิ๊นส้มหมก
description: Chin som is the northern Thai version of the pickled pork sausage called naem . In chin som mok (lit. "covered chin som ") the pickled pork is grilled inside a banana leaf before serving.

thai_script: จิ๊นฮุ่ม
description: It is a slowly stewed meat curry from northern Thailand. This particular version is made with beef.

thai_script: ฉู่ฉี่ปลากะพง
description: A semi-dry red curry with fried Snapper .

thai_script: น้ำพริกกุ้งสด
description: A spicy Thai chili paste made with fresh shrimp, chili, garlic, and lime, typically served with fresh or steamed vegetables.

thai_script: ฉู่ฉี่ปลาทูสด
description: A semi-dry curry made with fresh (i.e. unsteamed and unsalted) pla thu ( Rastrelliger brachysoma ). The version in the image was made at a southern Thai restaurant.

thai_script: ฉู่ฉี่หมูกรอบ
english_name: Choo Chee Curry with Crispy Pork
description: Crispy pork belly simmered in a thick and aromatic choo chee red curry sauce with coconut milk and fragrant herbs.

thai_script: ฉู่ฉี่หมูป่า
english_name: Choo Chee Curry with Wild Boar
description: Wild boar meat cooked in a spicy choo chee curry, offering a richer and gamier flavor than standard pork curries.

thai_script: ชาดำเย็น
description: It is made from strongly brewed black tea ("red tea" in East Asia). The tea is sweetened with sugar and served with ice.

thai_script: ชามะนาว
description: It is made from strongly brewed black tea ("red tea" in East Asia). The tea is sweetened with sugar flavored with sugar and lime and served hot or with ice. Mint may also be added.

thai_script: ชาร้อน
description: It is made from strongly brewed black tea ("red tea" in East Asia). The tea is sweetened with sugar and condensed milk and served hot.

thai_script: ชาเย็น
description: It is made from strongly brewed black tea ("red tea" in East Asia). Additional ingredients may include orange blossom water, star anise, crushed tamarind seed and sometimes other spices. The tea is sweetened with sugar and condensed milk and served chilled.

thai_script: ซอสศรีราชา
description: It is a hot sauce made from sun-ripened chili peppers, vinegar, garlic, sugar, and salt. It is commonly known in Thailand as sot Si Racha ( sot is the Thai pronunciation of the English word "sauce"), but also as nam chim Si Racha or nam phrik Si Racha . The name is derived from the seaside town of Si Racha .

thai_script: ซี่โครงหมูทอด
description: Deep-fried pork ribs. The version in the image however, had first been boiled, then marinated, then deep-fried with garlic, and then again stir-fried with a sweet and tangy tamarind sauce just before serving.

thai_script: ซี่โครงหมูทอดกระเทียม
description: Pork ribs marinated and deep-fried until golden, topped with crispy fried garlic for a savory and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: ซุปกระดูกหมู
description: A light and fragrant soup made with pork ribs simmered with Thai herbs, often flavored with lime, chili, and fish sauce.

thai_script: ดาราทอง
description: Dara thong or thong ek krachang (ทองเอกกระจัง) is a golden dough ball made from wheat flour, egg yolks, coconut milk, and sugar, topped with a little piece of gold leaf, and decorated with sugar-coated, dry-fried watermelon seeds. Nowadays, it is often wrongly referred to as cha mongkut (จ่ามงกุฎ), which is the name of another Thai traditional sweet.

thai_script: ตับไก่ผัดพริกสด
english_name: Stir-fried chicken liver with green peppers
description: Chicken liver fried with young (mainly green) chili peppers, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, onion, spring onion, black pepper, and garlic. Here it is served with rice and a fried egg ( khai dao ).

thai_script: ตัวไหมทอด
description: Crispy, deep-fried pupae of silkworms . This dish is most often eaten as a snack in order to go with any drink.

thai_script: ตำขนุน
description: A spicy Northern Thai salad made with boiled green whole jackfruit which has been mashed with a mortar and pestle, and minced pork. It is normally eaten with sticky rice and (as seen on the image) with khaep mu (pork cracklings).

thai_script: ตำผลไม้รวม
description: The fruits used in this particular salad show the fusion aspect of Thai cuisine, as it incorporates "modern" (for Thais) fruit such as apples and grapes besides traditional fruit such as pineapple and guava. The dressing is made with pounded garlic, sugar, chili peppers, dried shrimp, lime juice and fish sauce, and is similar to that of som tam .

thai_name: Tam maphrao on sen mi krop
thai_script: ตำมะพร้าวอ่อนเส้นหมี่กรอบ
english_name: Tam maphrao on sen mi krop
description: A som tam style salad made with the meat of a young coconut and served with crispy deep-fried thin Chinese rice noodles.

thai_script: ตำมะม่วง
description: A som tam style salad with tangy unripe mango "au Julienne" as its main ingredient. The version in the image contains pla haeng thot , deep-fried sun-dried anchovies.

thai_script: ตำมะเขือ
description: Chopped and then pounded grilled long green eggplant ( makhuea yao ; Thai : มะเขือยาว ), grilled green chili peppers, raw garlic and salt put in a banana leaf package mixed together with hard-boiled egg. It's a speciality of Northern Thailand where it is traditionally eaten with sticky rice .

thai_script: ตำส้มโอน้ำปู
description: It is a spicy pomelo salad which uses crab extract as a flavouring. This black sauce is achieved by pounding pu na ("ricefield crabs", Somanniathelphusa ) to a pulp, straining the juices which are then boiled and reduced until the sauce becomes as thick as molasses.

thai_script: ตำหมากหุ่ง
description: This version is more spicy, salty, and less sweet of som tam that contains pla ra (a sauce of fermented fish), and very often also brined rice paddy crabs, and makok (the fruit of the Spondias mombin ) besides the usual ingredients for som tam . It does not however contain peanuts.

thai_script: ตำหมูยอ
description: A spicy Thai salad made with mu yo , a Thai pork sausage which is often also described in Thailand as "Vietnamese sausage". The dressing is somewhat similar to that of som tam .

thai_script: ต้มข่าไก่
description: A mild to spicy soup with coconut milk, galangal ( kha ) and chicken. Mushrooms can be added to the chicken or substitute it. [ 1 ]

thai_script: ต้มผักกาดดองหมู
description: A soup of boiled pickled Chinese cabbage and pork ribs. This dish is Chinese in origin.

thai_script: ต้มมะระ
description: A clear soup made with bitter melon (also known as bitter gourd; Momordica charantia ) of Chinese origin. It is often stuffed with minced pork or with minced pork mixed with glass noodles as on this image. The full name of the latter version would then be tom mara yat sai mu sap wunsen .

thai_script: ต้มยำ
description: A hot and sour broth made from lemon grass , galangal , kaffir lime leaves, dried chili peppers, and lime juice, usually with prawns ( Tom yam kung ) or chicken ( Tom yam kai ). [ 1 ] [ 2 ]

thai_script: ต้มยำทะเลใส,ข้น
english_name: Clear or Creamy Tom Yum with Seafood
description: A classic Thai hot and sour soup made with mixed seafood and fragrant herbs, available in a clear broth (sai) or a creamy version (khon) with chili paste and evaporated milk.

thai_script: ต้มยำปลาคัง
description: A spicy and sour soup featuring catfish simmered with lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and fresh chili.

thai_name: Tom Yum Pla Yang Hed Ruam
thai_script: ต้มยำปลาย่างเห็ดรวม
english_name: Tom Yum with Grilled Fish and Mixed Mushrooms
description: A flavorful tom yum soup combining smoky grilled fish with assorted mushrooms in a spicy and tangy broth.

thai_script: ต้มยำปลาแรด
description: A hot and sour soup made with giant gourami fish, known for its firm texture, infused with fresh Thai herbs and chili.

thai_script: ต้มยำหมูสามชั้น
english_name: Tom Yum Soup with Pork Belly
description: A spicy and sour Thai soup made with tender slices of pork belly, flavored with lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chili.

thai_script: ต้มยำโบราณ
description: Tom yam boran is noodles served in a thick spicy sour sauce or broth, with crushed dried chili peppers, chopped peanuts, and blanched vegetables such as bean sprouts. This version is bami mu tom yam boran : with egg noodles and pork.

thai_script: ต้มส้มกระดูกหมู
description: Tom som translates to "sour soup". This particular version is a basic one with only pork ribs ( kraduk mu ) and it derives its sourness from lime juice. Other types of tom som can also use tamarind for acidity, or a combination of both lime and tamarind, and can be made from a multitude of ingredients: meats as well as seafood, and vegetables. [ 1 ]

thai_script: ต้มเยื่อไผ่
description: It is a clear broth with, amongst other ingredients, yuea phai ("bamboo fungus"; Phallus indusiatus )

thai_script: ต้มแซบหมูตุ๋น
english_name: Spicy and Sour Soup with Stewed Pork
description: A northeastern Thai (Isan) style hot and sour soup made with slow-stewed pork, enhanced with herbs, lime, and chili for a bold flavor.

thai_script: ต้มแซ่บ
description: A spicy soup made with stewed meat (usually pork, chicken or beef), roasted fresh herbs and spices, ground roasted rice, and generous amounts of lime juice and fresh herbs just before serving.

thai_script: ต้มโคล้ง
description: It is a spicy and sour soup somewhat similar to Tom yam. The sourness however does not derive from lime juice but through the use of tamarind juice. The version in the image contains fried smoked fish, tomato, and mushrooms. [ 1 ]

thai_script: ถั่วงอกปลาเค็ม
english_name: Stir-fried bean sprouts with salted fish
description: A stir-fried dish of mung bean sprouts, salted fish, chili peppers, and garlic.

thai_script: ถุงทอง
description: Small, crispy, deep-fried pastry purses filled with a mixture of minced chicken or pork together with minced prawns, mushroom and water chestnut , and served with sweet plum sauce or Thai sweet chili sauce.

thai_script: ทองหยิบ
description: Thong yip is made from egg yolks like foi thong . The difference is that instead of being thread-like, thong yip are shaped like flowers.

thai_script: ทอดมันกุ้ง
description: Another popular variety of thot man where minced shrimp or prawn is used. Plum sauce is commonly provided.

thai_script: ทอดมันข้าวโพด/ข้าวโพดทอด
description: Deep-fried cakes made with corn and herbs in a batter and served with a sweet chili sauce

thai_script: ทอดมันปลา/ปลาเห็ด
description: Deep fried patties of minced fish mixed with red curry paste, finely chopped yardlong beans ( tua fak yao ), and finely shredded leaves of kaffir lime ( makrut ). Knife fish (pla krai) is popularly used. For this variety of thot man, a sweet & hot similar to chicken chili sauce is provided usually mixed with chopped pieces of cucumber, crushed peanuts, and topped with phak chi .

thai_script: ทอดมันปู
description: Deep fried patties of minced crab meat. Plum sauce is commonly provided.

thai_script: ทอดมันหัวปลี
description: Tod Mun Hua Plee is one of the individual dishes in Thailand. It is made from banana blossom which is the flower of banana.

thai_script: ทะเลผัดผงกะหรี่
english_name: Stir-fried Seafood with Yellow Curry Powder
description: A rich and flavorful dish of mixed seafood stir-fried with yellow curry powder, egg, celery, and onions for a creamy texture and aromatic taste.

thai_script: ทาร์ตไข่
description: The Thai version of the Portuguese pastel de nata .

thai_script: นมเย็น
description: A drink made from sala syrup and hot milk.

thai_script: นอกหม้อรวมมิตร
english_name: Mixed Hot Pot Outside the Pot
description: A variety of meats, seafood, and vegetables cooked separately but served in the style of a Thai hot pot meal.

thai_script: นักเก็ต
description: Deep-fried breaded chicken pieces, a popular snack and side dish influenced by Western fast food.

thai_script: น้ำจิ้มสะเต๊ะ
description: A peanut sauce which is normally served with satay .

thai_script: น้ำจิ้มแจ่ว
description: It is a sticky, sweet and spicy dipping sauce made with dried chili peppers, fish sauce, palm sugar, lime juice, and coarsely roasted sticky rice. Often served as a dip with mu yang (grilled pork).

thai_script: น้ำจิ้มแป๊ะซะ
description: A spicy dipping sauce eaten with steamed fish wrapped in raw lettuce or cabbage.

thai_script: น้ำจิ้มไก่
description: A very common all-round chili dipping sauce with the consistency of a thick syrup, it is medium spicy and very sweet. Often used as a dipping sauce for grilled chicken ( kai means "chicken"), it can also be used as a generic chili sauce for other dishes. It forms the base of a few other types of nam chim , such as nam chim thot man pla ("dipping sauce for deep-fried fish cakes").

thai_script: น้ำซุป
description: This is a clear broth, usually served together with khao man kai (chicken rice), khao mok (Thai biryani ), khao kha mu (pork trotter simmered in soy sauce served with rice), khao na pet (red roast duck on rice), or khao mu daeng ( red roast pork on rice). The broth can be made from chicken or pork, or it can be wholly vegetarian. The version served with duck is usually made from duck bones. It will often contain sliced hua chai thao (white radish ; also known as phak kat hua in Thai) and hua chai po khem (a Chinese ingredient of dried and salted chopped turnip). Garlic, ginger, and pepper are often used as additional ingredients. It is most often garnished with fresh coriander leaves or spring onion.

thai_script: น้ำดอกอัญชัน
description: A refreshing drink made from Clitoria ternatea flower flavored with sugar served with ice.

thai_script: น้ำตะไคร้
description: A refreshing drink made from lemongrass. It can be served either hot or with ice.

thai_script: น้ำปลาพริก
description: Colloquially called phrik nam pla , it is a standard sauce served with every Thai buffet style meal, fried rice or fried noodles, and used as a kind of "salt". It is made by mixing fish sauce with some lime juice, chopped bird's eye chili peppers, and often also sliced garlic.

thai_script: น้ำพริกกะปิ
description: A pungent chili dip made with shrimp paste , pounded dried shrimp, bird's eye chili peppers, garlic, lime juice, fish sauce, palm sugar, and optionally, pea sized aubergines ; most often eaten as part of the dish called Nam phrik pla thu .

thai_name: Nam phrik kapi kap pla thu thot
thai_script: น้ำพริกกะปิกับปลาทูทอด
english_name: Nam phrik kapi kap pla thu thot
description: Fried pla thu served with nam phrik kapi , a pungent dip made mainly from shrimp paste and chili peppers, and raw, steamed or fried vegetables (often pieces of cha-om omelette). It is eaten with khanom chin (Thai rice noodles) or steamed rice. Although the name of this dish is often shortened to nam phrik pla thu , this refers to a certain type of chili paste in which pla thu is used as an ingredient.

thai_script: ฉู่ฉี่ปลาคังคัง
description: Catfish cooked in a thick and fragrant choo chee red curry sauce with coconut milk and kaffir lime leaves, offering a rich and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: น้ำพริกข่า
description: A Northern Thai fried chili paste containing galangal ( kha ). It is often eaten, as seen here, with steamed het nang fa (Thai script: เห็ดนางฟ้า; lit. "fairy mushroom"; Pleurotus pulmonarius).

thai_script: น้ำพริกปลาจี่
description: A chili paste made with grilled fish, roasted chili peppers, roasted shallots, and roasted garlic, lemongrass, and shrimp paste. It is normally served with both steamed and raw vegetables or other leaves.

thai_script: น้ำพริกลงเรือ
description: The name means "chili paste for in a boat" as it was often eaten while travelling the rivers of Thailand by boat. A sweet, savoury and spicy chili dip, it is served together with fresh vegetables, salted egg and sweet pork. This version also included khamin khao ("white curcuma") and the slightly sour and bitter leaves of makok ( Spondias mombin )

thai_script: น้ำพริกหนุ่ม
description: A paste of pounded roasted large green chili peppers, roasted shallots, roasted garlic, coriander leaves, lime juice, and fish sauce that is eaten with steamed and raw vegetables, khaep mu (crispy pork rind), and sticky rice.

thai_script: น้ำพริกอีเก๋
description: A northern Thai chili paste made with chili peppers, sliced aubergine, pork rinds, and fermented shrimp paste.

thai_script: น้ำพริกอ่อง
description: Resembling a thick Bolognese sauce , it is made with dried chili peppers, minced pork, and tomato that is eaten with steamed vegetables, raw vegetables, and sticky rice.

thai_script: น้ำพริกเผา
description: A sweet roasted chili paste, often used as an ingredient in Tom yam or when frying meat or seafood, and also popular as a spicy "jam" on bread or toasted bread.

thai_script: น้ำพริกเผาหมูกรอบ
description: A flavorful dish made with Thai roasted chili paste stir-fried with crispy pork belly, creating a balance of spicy, sweet, and savory flavors.

thai_script: น้ำพริกแคบหมู
description: A northern Thai chili paste of mashed grilled green chili peppers, deep-fried pork rinds, fresh garlic, and salt.

thai_script: น้ำพริกแจ่วหมู
description: A northeastern Thai chili dip (nam prik jaew) made with roasted chili, herbs, and pork, typically enjoyed with sticky rice and fresh vegetables.

thai_script: น้ำพันช์
description: Resembling a slush puppie laced with alcohol, this drink is popular with students. Nam means liquid or water, phan is derived from the English word " punch ": a beverage based on fruit and often containing alcohol.

thai_script: น้ำมะนาว
description: A refreshing drink made from lime juice flavored with sugar and a pinch of salt served with ice.

thai_script: น้ำหวาน
description: Normally poured on grated ice.

thai_script: น้ำใบบัวบก
description: A refreshing drink made from the leaves of the Asiatic Pennywort ( Centella asiatica ).

thai_script: บะหมี่หมูแดง
description: Originally a Chinese dish, it is now common in Thailand. Often served with chili peppers in vinegar, and dried chili flakes. The version shown in the photo also contains kiao kung ( Thai : เกี๊ยวกุ้ง ; prawn wontons ).

thai_script: บะหมี่แห้งเป็ด
description: Egg noodles served "dry" with slices of braised duck, and often, as shown on the image, together with "blood tofu". The broth is served on the side. It is originally a Chinese dish.

thai_script: บะหมือบกุ้ง
description: A noodle dish featuring egg noodles served with shrimp, often garnished with vegetables and light seasoning.

thai_script: ปลากดลวกจิ้ม
description: Catfish lightly boiled and served with a spicy dipping sauce, highlighting the fish’s natural flavor.

thai_script: ปลากระพงทอดน้ำปลา
english_name: Deep-fried Sea Bass with Fish Sauce
description: Whole sea bass deep-fried until crispy, topped with a savory fish sauce glaze and served with fresh herbs.

thai_name: Pla Kapong Tod Pad Prik Glua
thai_script: ปลากระพงทอดผัดพริกเกลือ
english_name: Deep-fried Sea Bass with Chili and Salt
description: Crispy fried sea bass stir-fried with salt, garlic, and fresh chilies for a spicy and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: ปลากระพงนึ่งซีอิ๊ว/มะนาว
english_name: Steamed Sea Bass with Soy Sauce or Lime
description: Whole sea bass steamed and served either with a savory soy sauce base or a tangy lime, garlic, and chili dressing.

thai_name: Pla Kapong Pad Prik Thai Dam
thai_script: ปลากระพงผัดพริกไทยดำ
english_name: Stir-fried Sea Bass with Black Pepper
description: Sea bass fillets stir-fried with black pepper, garlic, and vegetables, creating a bold and aromatic dish.

thai_script: ปลากระพงลุยสวน
english_name: Sea Bass with Spicy Garden-style Dressing
description: Deep-fried sea bass topped with a zesty mix of fresh herbs, garlic, lime, and chilies, known as 'garden style' dressing.

thai_script: ปลากรายทอดกระเทียม
description: Deep-fried pla krai (" Clown Knifefish ") and garlic. It is served with a spicy dipping sauce on the side made from coriander root, lime juice, fresh bird's eye chili peppers, garlic, sugar, and fish sauce.

thai_script: ปลากะพงทอดสามรส
english_name: Deep-fried Sea Bass with Three-flavor Sauce
description: Crispy fried sea bass topped with a sweet, sour, and spicy sauce, creating a balanced and flavorful Thai classic.

thai_script: ปลากะพงผัดขึ้นฉ่าย
description: Barramundi (often called "sea bass" in Thailand) stir-fried with Chinese celery, light soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and fermented soy beans.

thai_script: ปลาคังคั่วพริกเกลือ
english_name: Stir-fried Catfish with Chili and Salt
description: Catfish stir-fried with garlic, chili, and salt for a spicy, savory flavor with a crispy texture.

thai_script: ปลาคังทอดกระเทียม
description: Catfish deep-fried until golden and crispy, topped with fried garlic for an aromatic finish.

thai_script: ปลาคังผัดแห้ง
description: Catfish stir-fried without broth, seasoned with herbs and spices to create a dry and flavorful dish.

thai_script: ปลาคังลวกจิ้ม
description: Catfish lightly boiled and served with a spicy dipping sauce, highlighting the natural flavor of the fish.

thai_script: ปลาดุกผัดเผ็ด
english_name: Stir-fired sliced catfish with red curry paste
description: Slices of catfish (most often pre-fried) are stir-fried in a sauce made with red curry paste. The pea eggplant feature in this dish is for added taste and texture.

thai_name: Pla Duk Foo Pad Kee Mao
thai_script: ปลาดุกฟูผัดขี้เมา
description: Crispy fried catfish flakes stir-fried with Thai herbs, chili, and spices in a 'drunken' stir-fry style known for its bold and fiery flavor.

thai_script: ปลาทอด
description: A simple deep-fried fish, most often served with a spicy dipping sauce. The fish in this image is pla nin , a Nile Tilapia .

thai_script: ปลาทอดขมิ้น
description: Typical for southern Thai cuisine, this deep-fried fish has first been marinated in a spice mixture which includes a large amount of turmeric ( khamin ). In addition, this particular version was topped with crispy deep-fried chopped garlic and turmeric. It is often served with raw vegetables on the side, and a spicy dipping sauce.

thai_script: ปลาทับทิมนึ่งมะนาว/นึ่งซีอิ๊ว
english_name: Steamed Ruby Fish with Lime or Soy Sauce
description: Ruby fish (tilapia) steamed and served with either a tangy lime, garlic, and chili dressing or a savory soy sauce base.

thai_script: ปลานิลทอดสมุนไพร
description: Deep-fried pla nin ("Nile Tilipia") served with deep-fried herbs such as lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, garlic, and fingerroot ( Boesenbergia rotunda ). A chili-lime dip is served on the side as a condiment.

thai_script: ปลานึ่งมะนาว
description: Steamed fish which is drenched in a spicy garlic, chili sauce, chicken stock and lime juice dressing.

thai_script: ปลาบ้วง
description: Cuts of Giant snakehead fish ( pla chado ) are first salted and sun-dried for three days, and then deep-fried. This dish is somewhat similar to pla chado daet diao from central Thailand but there the fish is only dried for only one day, making the taste less intense.

thai_script: ปลาปิ้งตบ
description: Traditional grilled fish of Tai Dam people in Loei .Catch the fish to clean the scales, then peck the fish along the back of the spine instead of the belly so that the soft fish will fold up more easily and the spice stuffed in the belly of the fish exposed to embers will give fragrance to infuse the fish meat.

thai_script: ปลาวงทอด
description: Deep-fried pla wong (literally meaning "circle fish"): fish which have first been cut open, arranged into a circle and then sun-dried. Here it is served Southern Thai style with a spoonful of a deep-fried mix of minced garlic, galangal, and turmeric.

thai_script: ปลาสามทัพ
description: Fish prepared in 3 different ways: on the left of the image is pla sam rot (deep-fried served with a tangy sweet chili sauce), in the middle pla nueng manao (steamed fish with a raw garlic, lime and chili sauce), and on the right pla thot krathiam (deep-fried fish with deep-fried garlic).

thai_script: ปลาสามรส
description: Deep fried fish with a sweet, tangy, and spicy tamarind sauce.

thai_script: ปลาหมึกผัดพริกป่น
description: Tender squid stir-fried with ground dried chili, garlic, and Thai seasonings for a spicy and aromatic dish.

thai_script: ปลาหมึกผัดพริกเผา
description: Squid stir-fried with sweet and mild chili paste ( nam phrik phao ), onion, garlic, spring onion, and sliced large red chili peppers. Paprika can be used instead of chili peppers if a milder version is preferred.

thai_script: ปลาหมึกผัดไข่เค็ม
description: Squid stir-fried with salted egg yolk, chili, and curry leaves, creating a rich, creamy, and savory flavor.

thai_script: ปลาหมึกย่าง
description: Plainly grilled cuttlefish .

thai_script: ปลาหิมะนึ่งซีอิ๊ว
english_name: Steamed Snow Fish with Soy Sauce
description: Snow fish delicately steamed and served with a savory soy sauce dressing, highlighting its soft and buttery texture.

thai_name: Pla Rad/Pla Tubtim Tod Kratiem Prik Thai Dam
thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ทอดกระเทียมพริกไทยดำ
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Garlic and Black Pepper
description: Gourami or tilapia deep-fried and seasoned with garlic and black pepper for a fragrant, crispy dish.

thai_name: Pla Rad/Pla Tubtim Tod Pad Prik Thai Dam
thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ทอดผัดพริกไทยดำ
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Black Pepper Stir-fry
description: Crispy gourami or tilapia stir-fried with black pepper and aromatics for a bold, savory flavor.

thai_name: Pla Rad/Pla Tubtim Tod Yum Mamuang
thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ทอดยำมะม่วง
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Mango Salad
description: Crispy fried fish topped with a tangy and spicy Thai green mango salad.

thai_name: Pla Rad/Pla Tubtim Tod Samun Phrai
thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ทอดสมุนไพร
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Herbs
description: Whole fish deep-fried until crispy, topped with fried Thai herbs like lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.

thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม นึ่งมะนาว
english_name: Steamed Gourami or Tilapia with Lime
description: Steamed fish served in a tangy and spicy lime, chili, and garlic sauce, a refreshing Thai classic.

thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม น้ำตก
english_name: Spicy Grilled Gourami or Tilapia Salad
description: Fish cooked and tossed with roasted rice powder, lime, chili, and herbs in the Isan-style 'nam tok' salad.

thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ราดพริก
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Chili Sauce
description: Crispy fried fish topped with a sweet and spicy chili sauce.

thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม ลุยสวน
english_name: Gourami or Tilapia with Garden-style Dressing
description: Deep-fried fish topped with a mix of fresh herbs, lime, garlic, and chili, known as 'garden style' dressing.

thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม สามรส
english_name: Deep-fried Gourami or Tilapia with Three-flavor Sauce
description: Crispy fried fish dressed with a sweet, sour, and spicy sauce for a perfectly balanced Thai flavor.

thai_name: Pla Rad, Pla Thapthim Phao Kluea
thai_script: ปลาแรด, ปลาทับทิม เผาเกลือ
english_name: Grilled Giant Gourami or Tilapia with Salt
description: Whole gourami or tilapia coated with salt and grilled over charcoal, keeping the fish moist and flavorful.

thai_script: ปลาแรดคั่วพริกเกลือ
english_name: Giant Gourami with Chili and Salt
description: Crispy giant gourami stir-fried with garlic, chili, and salt for a spicy and aromatic taste.

thai_script: ปลาแรดซอสมะขาม
description: Fried giant gourami topped with a sweet and tangy tamarind sauce, garnished with fried shallots and chilies.

thai_script: ปลาแรดทอดกระเทียม
description: Golden fried giant gourami served with crispy garlic, offering a fragrant and savory flavor.

thai_script: ปาท่องโก๋
description: The Thai version of the Chinese crullers called youtiao , they tend to be smaller than the Chinese original. Most often eaten with sweetened condensed milk or with Thai coconut jam , they can also be served with chok , Thai rice congee .

thai_script: ปีกไก่คั่วพริกเกลือ
english_name: Fried Chicken Wings with Chili and Salt
description: Crispy chicken wings stir-fried with garlic, chili, and salt for a spicy and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: ปีกไก่ทอดจิ้มแจ่ว
english_name: Fried Chicken Wings with Jaew Sauce
description: Deep-fried chicken wings served with jaew, a smoky and spicy dipping sauce from Northeastern Thailand.

thai_script: ปีกไก่ทอดเกลือ
description: Simple and crispy deep-fried chicken wings lightly seasoned with salt for a savory snack or side dish.

thai_script: ปีกไก่สอดไส้ทอด
description: Deep fried, partially deboned chicken wings, stuffed usually with minced pork.

thai_script: ปูจ๋า
description: A mixture of cooked crab meat, pork, garlic, and pepper, fried deeply inside the crab shells and usually served with nam chim buoy ( Thai : น้ำจิ้มบ๋วย , plum sauce). Instead of being fried in the crab shell, it is also sometimes served as patties.

thai_name: Poo Nim Pad Sos Khai Kem
thai_script: ปูนิ่มผัดซอสไข่เค็ม
english_name: Stir-fried Soft-shell Crab with Salted Egg Sauce
description: Crispy soft-shell crab stir-fried in a rich and creamy salted egg yolk sauce, giving it a savory and slightly sweet flavor.

thai_script: ปูนิ่มผัดผงกะหรี่
english_name: Stir-fried soft-shelled crab with curry powder
description: Deep-fried pieces of soft-shell crab which have been stir-fried with egg and curry powder.

thai_script: ปูผัดผงกะหรี่
description: A famous Thai-Chinese dish where crab is stir-fried with curry powder, egg, milk, and onions for a rich and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: ปูผัดพริกเกลือ
english_name: Stir-fried Crab with Chili and Salt
description: Fresh crab stir-fried with garlic, chili, and salt, giving it a spicy, savory, and fragrant taste.

thai_script: ปูผัดพริกไทยดำ
description: Crab stir-fried with black pepper, garlic, and onions for a bold and peppery flavor.

thai_script: ปูม้าผัดกระเทียม
description: Blue crab stir-fried with garlic and light seasoning, creating a simple yet aromatic dish.

thai_script: ปูอ่อง or อ่องปู
description: A northern Thai speciality that is eaten as a pungent dipping sauce for sticky rice. It is made by collecting the "fat" of rice field crabs ( Parathelphusidae ) and grilling this inside the crab shell.

thai_script: ป่ามไข่มด
description: Grilled banana leaf cups containing a mixture of ant eggs, chicken eggs and some salt. After grilling the dish is sprinkled with chopped spring onion and pepper. The ant eggs make the dish much more creamy. It can also be eaten as a snack.

thai_name: Phak Kat Khao Nam Man Hoi
thai_script: ผักกาดขาวน้ำมันหอย
english_name: Stir-fried Napa Cabbage with Oyster Sauce
description: Tender napa cabbage stir-fried with garlic and oyster sauce for a simple yet flavorful side dish.

thai_script: ผักบุ้งไฟแดง
description: Morning-glory (a.k.a. water spinach ) stir fried with yellow bean sauce , garlic, and chili peppers. It is a very popular vegetable dish in Thailand.

thai_script: ผัดกะเพรา
english_name: Stir-fired minced meat with thai holy basil
description: Minced beef, pork, chicken, or whole prawns stir fried with Thai holy basil, chili peppers, garlic, and soy sauce.

thai_script: ผัดคะน้าหมูกรอบ
english_name: Stir-fried Chinese kale with crispy pork
description: Khana ( gailan or Chinese kale) is stir fried with crispy pork ( mu krop ), garlic, oyster sauce, soy sauce, peppercorns, and (optionally) sliced chili peppers.

thai_name: Pad Cha / Choo Chee Pla Kang
thai_script: ผัดฉ่า/ฉู่ฉี่ปลาคัง
english_name: Spicy Stir-fried or Choo Chee Catfish
description: Catfish prepared either as Pad Cha, a fiery stir-fry with herbs and chili, or as Choo Chee, a rich red curry sauce.

thai_name: Pad Cha / Choo Chee Pla Rad
thai_script: ผัดฉ่า/ฉู่ฉี่ปลาแรด
english_name: Spicy Stir-fried or Choo Chee Giant Gourami
description: Giant gourami served either stir-fried with spicy herbs or in a creamy Choo Chee curry sauce.

thai_script: ผัดซีอิ๊ว
description: Usually wide rice noodles fried with chicken or pork, and soy sauce.

thai_script: ผัดดอกหอม
english_name: Stir-fried onion flower stem with pork/liver
description: Stir-fried onion flowers with pork and pork liver.

thai_script: ผัดบวบ
description: Stir-fried luffa (sponge gourd) with pork/shrimp and egg or just egg.

thai_script: ผัดผัก 4 สหาย
description: A colorful stir-fry featuring four types of vegetables, often mushrooms, baby corn, carrots, and snow peas.

thai_name: Pad Phak Tam Rue Doo Kan
thai_script: ผัดผักตามฤดูกาล
description: Fresh seasonal vegetables stir-fried with oyster sauce, garlic, and light seasoning for a simple, flavorful dish.

thai_script: ผัดผักรวม
description: Stir fried combination of vegetables depending on availability and preference, but it is usually fried with oyster sauce .

thai_script: ผัดผักรวมมิตร
description: A healthy stir-fry of assorted seasonal vegetables cooked with garlic and oyster sauce.

thai_script: ผัดผักโขม
english_name: Stir-fried thai spinach with egg and minced pork
description: Thai spinach ( Amaranthus spinosus ; Thai name: Phak khom nam ; Thai script: ผักโขมหนาม) is often stir-fried with minced pork and egg.

thai_script: ผัดพริก
english_name: Stir-fried pork with Thai chili peppers
description: Sliced pork fried with asparagus beans and kaffir lime leaves in a sweet chili paste. Sometimes red curry paste is used instead of the phrik khing chili paste.

thai_script: ผัดมาม่า
description: Mama ( Thai : มาม่า ) is the most popular brand of instant noodles in Thailand and the brand name is commonly used, instead of the generic bami kueng samret rup ( Thai : บะหมี่กึ่งสำเร็จรูป ), to designate instant noodles. The particular version in the image has been stir-fried " drunken noodle "-style.

thai_script: ผัดยอดฟักแม้ว
description: Yot sayongte, which is also known in Thailand as yot fak meao ( yot meaning " shoots "), are the young vines and leaves of a certain type of melon ( chayote , originally from Central America) which in Thailand grows mainly in the mountains up north. These greens have a very sweet taste and combine extremely well with oyster sauce.

thai_script: ผัดวุ้นเส้น
description: Glass noodles are stir-fried with egg and vegetables, and a variety of ingredients such as meat, seafood, or with vegetarian alternatives.

thai_script: ผัดหน่อไม้ใส่ไข่
description: Stir-fried bamboo shoots and egg.

thai_script: ผัดหมี่โคราช
description: A stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served with papaya salad ( som tam ). Dried rice noodle (of many colors) is a specific ingredient; made with dried rice noodle, garlic, shallot, pork, salt soya, beans, fish sauce, palm sugar, red pepper, black soy sauce, water, spring onion and bean sprouts. Traditionally used to exploit preserved old rice; used in religious ceremonies.

thai_script: ผัดเผ็ดปลาทอด
description: Crispy fried fish stir-fried with curry paste, chili, and herbs for a bold and spicy flavor.

thai_name: Pad Phet Moo Pa Nor Mai Dong
thai_script: ผัดเผ็ดหมูป่าหน่อไม้ดอง
english_name: Stir-fried Spicy Wild Boar with Pickled Bamboo Shoots
description: A rustic stir-fry of wild boar meat with spicy curry paste and pickled bamboo shoots for an earthy, tangy taste.

thai_script: ผัดเห็ดนํ้ามันหอย
description: Tender mushrooms stir-fried with oyster sauce and garlic, creating a savory and aromatic side dish.

thai_script: ผัดแขนงหมู
description: Stir-fried khanaeng with pork, garlic, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and white pepper. Khanaeng are the sprouts of Chinese broccoli and grow from the root after the main stem has been harvested. The taste is in between Brussels sprouts and kale , and very sweet.

thai_script: ผัดแหนมไส่ไข่
description: Naem sausage (made from fermented raw pork skin and sticky rice) stir fried with egg.

thai_script: ผัดไทย
description: Stir fried medium size rice noodles ( sen lek ) with fish sauce, sugar, lime juice or tamarind pulp, ground peanuts, egg, bean sprouts, and Chinese chives ( kuichai ), combined with shrimp.

thai_script: ฝอยทอง
description: The name translates to "golden threads", it is a sweet snack or dessert of strings of egg yolk shortly boiled in sugar syrup. This, and other egg-based sweets such as sangkhaya , were introduced to the royal court of Ayutthaya by Maria Guyomar de Pinha in the 17th century CE.

thai_script: พริกเผาหมูกรอบ
description: Crispy pork belly stir-fried with Thai roasted chili paste, creating a rich, spicy, and slightly sweet flavor.

thai_script: พล่ากุ้ง
description: A spicy salad of prawns, sliced lemongrass, culantro or other herbs, and shallots , with a dressing of lime juice, sweet chilli paste ( Nam phrik phao – optional), fish sauce, pounded garlic and bird's eye chili . The version shown in the image also contained minced pork.

thai_script: พล่าหมู
description: A spicy salad of sliced grilled pork, sliced lemongrass, mint, culantro (optional) and shallots , with a dressing of lime juice, sweet chili paste ( Nam phrik phao – optional), fish sauce, pounded garlic and bird's eye chili .

thai_script: พล่าเนื้อมะเขืออ่อน
description: A Thai salad made with medium rare beef and Thai aubergines. The sliced, raw eggplants are mixed in with the warm beef to soften them ( makhuea on means "soft aubergine"). This particular version of the salad was served with a nam tok -style dressing.

thai_script: มะม่วงดอง
description: Pickled green mango is often eaten as a semi-sweet snack.

thai_script: มะม่วงน้ำปลาหวาน
description: Tart, unripe mango served with a sweet, salty and spicy dipping sauce made from shallots, fish sauce, dried chili peppers, dried shrimp, and palm sugar ( nam pla wan means "sweet fish sauce"). This is normally eaten as a snack on its own.

thai_script: ยอดข้าวโพดผัดกุ้ง
description: A light and savory stir-fry of tender baby corn and shrimp, cooked with garlic and oyster sauce.

thai_script: ยำกุนเชียง
description: A Thai salad made with a sweet dried pork sausage called kun chiang . This sausage is of Chinese origin. This dish is often eaten with plain rice congee ( khao tom kui ; Thai : ข้าวต้มกุ๊ย ).

thai_script: ยำขนมจีน
description: Yum kanomjeen is a spicy and sour salad mixed with kanom jeen. Kanom jeen is thin rice noodles which are made from fresh rice sometimes fermented rice starch, fermented for few days, boiled and then made into noodles. The original kanom jeen came from the Mon people. The main ingredients of Yum kanom jeen are fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, and chili powder. Some places will add pla ra to Yum kanom jeen too. Pla ra is the Thai traditional ingredient produced by fermented fish. Yum kanom jeen has a good spicy and sour taste, but many people would like to order the flavor that they like. Yum kanom jeen is a low- calorie food and it has only 220 calories per dish. To suit for people who are healthy and want to diet. Yum kanom jeen is not difficult to find. It can be found in either restaurant or street food.

thai_script: ยำขมิ้นขาวกุ้ง
description: A spicy Thai salad made with finely sliced ( au Julienne ) "white curcuma" (probably Curcuma zedoaria ), shredded coconut, cooked prawns, sliced shallots, dried chillies, fresh green bird's eye chili peppers, roasted cashew nuts, and crispy fried onion rings.

thai_script: ยำจิ๊นไก่
description: A curry dish from Northern Thailand containing chicken. The version in the image also contains sliced banana flower.

thai_script: ยำตะไคร้กุ้งสด
description: A spicy "yam-style" salad with finely sliced raw lemongrass and prawns.

thai_script: ยำถั่วพู
description: A Thai salad with winged beans, salted eggs, toasted coconut, shallots, fish sauce, lime juice and chillies. The version in this image also contains squid.

thai_script: ยำทะเล
description: A spicy salad with mixed seafood (cuttlefish, shelled prawns, mussels), shallots, lime juice, fish sauce and Thai celery.

thai_script: ยำปลาคัง
description: A bold Thai salad made with tender pieces of catfish mixed with lime juice, chili, fish sauce, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ยำปลาดุกฟู
description: Crispy fried shredded pla duk (catfish) served with a spicy and tangy green mango salad.

thai_script: ยำปลาทู
description: Made with short mackerel ( pla thu ).

thai_script: ยำปลาสลิด
description: A Thai salad made with deep-fried, sun-dried snakeskin gourami..

thai_script: ยำปลาเค็ม
description: A Thai salad ( yam ) made with fried sun-dried salted fish ( pla khem ).

thai_script: ยำปลาแรด
description: A flavorful Thai salad featuring crispy fried giant gourami topped with chili, lime juice, fish sauce, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ยำผักกูด
description: A salad of edible fern shoots ( Diplazium esculentum ) and pork.

thai_script: ยำผักบุ้งกรอบ
description: Deep-fried morning glory tossed with chili, lime, fish sauce, and herbs for a crunchy and tangy salad.

thai_script: ยำมาม่าทะเล
description: A spicy salad made with Mama instant noodles mixed with shrimp, squid, and herbs in a lime and chili dressing.

thai_script: ยำรวมมิตรทะเล
description: A zesty salad of assorted seafood such as shrimp, squid, and mussels combined with lime, chili, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ยำวุ้นเส้น
description: A spicy salad with glass noodles ( cellophane noodles ), minced chicken or pork and often either mixed seafood, squid or prawns. Cloud ear fungus also often features in this dish.

thai_script: ยำวุ้นเส้นทะเล
description: A refreshing salad of glass noodles mixed with shrimp, squid, and herbs, tossed in a spicy lime dressing.

thai_script: ยำสะนัด
description: A northern Thai salad of roughly chopped, blanched vegetables that are then refried with a chili paste. It is served here together with northern Thai pork cracklings and deep-fried, sun-dried chili peppers.

thai_script: ยำสามกรอบ
description: A crunchy Thai salad made with three crispy ingredients, often pork rind, cashews, and fried shrimp, mixed with chili, lime, and herbs.

thai_script: ยำส้มโอ
description: A salad made with pomelo. The other ingredients are: sliced red bird's eye chili peppers, deep-fried sun-dried anchovies, roasted peanuts, fish sauce and tamarind juice.

thai_script: ยำหน่อไม้
description: A Northern Thai salad made with strips of boiled bamboo shoots, shallots, herbs, fish sauce, lime juice, and chili peppers.

thai_name: Yam no mai sai nam pu
thai_script: ยำหน่อไม้ใส่น้ำปู
english_name: Yam no mai sai nam pu
description: A northern Thai salad made with boiled bamboo shoots and a thick paste made from the rice paddy crabs.

thai_script: ยำหมูกรอบ
description: A Thai salad made with crispy belly pork ( mu krop ).

thai_script: ยำหมูยอ
description: A spicy yam-style Thai salad with mu yo ( Vietnamese sausage ).

thai_name: Yam mu yo thot khai dao
thai_script: ยำหมูยอทอดไข่ดาว
english_name: Yam mu yo thot khai dao
description: A spicy Thai salad made with crispy fried mu yo (Vietnamese sausage) and khai dao (fried egg).

thai_script: ยำหมูย่าง
description: A zesty Thai salad made with slices of grilled pork mixed with lime juice, chili, fish sauce, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ยำหมูหมัก
description: A tangy and savory salad prepared with marinated pork, tossed with chili, lime juice, and herbs for bold flavors.

thai_script: ยำหอยแครง
description: A spicy Thai salad made with blood cockles .

thai_script: ยำหัวปลีทอด
description: A spicy Thai yam-style salad with deep-fried slices of banana blossom as its main ingredient.

thai_script: ยำหูหมู
description: It is a salad made with thinly sliced, boiled pig's ears, the version in the image also contained fresh mint, lime juice, shallots, lemon grass, fish sauce and sugar.

thai_script: ยำเนื้อย่าง
description: A spicy salad of grilled beef, shallots, and Thai celery or spearmint.

thai_script: ยำเห็ดเข็มทอง
description: A light and tangy salad made with enoki mushrooms tossed in lime juice, chili, fish sauce, and fresh herbs.

thai_name: Yam Hed Khem Thong Thot Krop
thai_script: ยำเห็ดเข็มทองทอดกรอบ
description: Deep-fried enoki mushrooms mixed with chili, lime juice, and herbs for a crunchy and zesty Thai-style salad.

thai_script: ยำแหนมข้าวทอด
description: A Thai salad made of crumbled, crispy-fried curried rice balls (similar to a spherical croquette), fermented pork sausage, shallots, green chili peppers or dried chili flakes, peanuts, lime juice, fish sauce, and onion.

thai_script: ยำแหนมสด
description: A Thai salad containing sausage made from fermented raw pork and sticky rice ( naem sausage).

thai_script: ยำใบชา
description: A spicy Thai salad made with young, fresh tea leaves.

thai_script: ยำไก่ย่าง
description: A refreshing Thai salad made with sliced grilled chicken, lime juice, chili, fish sauce, and fresh herbs for a smoky and tangy flavor.

thai_script: ยำไข่ดาว
description: A spicy Thai salad made with fried egg ( khai dao ).

thai_script: ย่างรวมหมู
description: A northern Thai dish of different cuts of pork (including pig udder) that have been grilled. It is served with a dipping sauce.

thai_script: รวมมิตร
description: A chilled sweet snack/dessert with a mix of ingredients, such as sweetened chestnuts, jackfruit, lotus root, tapioca, and lot chong , in sweetened coconut milk.

thai_script: ลอดช่องน้ำกะทิ
description: Pandan -flavored rice flour noodles in sweetened coconut milk, similar to the Indonesian cendol .

thai_script: ลาบทะเล
description: A zesty Isan-style salad made with mixed seafood, roasted rice powder, chili, lime juice, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ลาบปลาทูทอด
description: Crispy fried mackerel tossed with roasted rice powder, lime juice, chili, and fresh herbs for a crunchy larb variation.

thai_script: ลาบหมูกรอบ
description: A bold and flavorful larb made with crispy pork belly mixed with lime, chili, and roasted rice powder.

thai_script: ลาบหมูคั่ว
description: A warm version of larb made with minced pork stir-fried with herbs, roasted rice, chili, and lime for a hearty taste.

thai_script: ลาบอีสาน
description: Northeastern style lap is a spicy and sour salad of minced raw or cooked meat (mainly pork, chicken or duck), shallots or onions, lime juice, fish sauce, chillies, ground roasted rice and mint.

thai_script: ลาบเนื้อดิบ
description: A northern Thai lap -style salad of sliced raw beef (the version in the image also shows slices of raw beef tripe ) and ground, dried spices.

thai_script: ลาบเหนือ
description: Northern Thai lap is completely different from lap from northeastern Thailand. Northern Thai lap is made by mixing raw or cooked minced meat (mainly pork, beef, chicken or fish) with an elaborate mix of dry spices and herbs. The northern Thai lap does not contain lime juice or fish sauce. The version in the image is lap khua , meaning that the meat has been fried.

thai_script: ลูกชิ้นปิ้ง
description: Meatballs made from fish, pork, beef or chicken are grilled on a stick and served with a spicy and tangy dipping sauce. The ones shown on the image are made with pork and beef. It is commonly sold from street stalls in Thailand.

thai_script: ล่าเตียง
description: It is an ancient Thai snack, because it appears in literature of King Rama II . It comprises shrimp, pork and peanut and wrapped by omelette to make a square shape.

thai_script: สปาเกตตีผัดขี้เมา
description: A Thai fusion dish where the name literally means spaghetti fried "shit-drunk" ( khi mao = extremely drunk). An explanation is that any dish fried this way is easy to make, spicy, and uses whatever ingredients are available at that time; great after a night out drinking when still hungry.

thai_script: สลัดกุ้งทอด
description: A refreshing salad topped with crispy fried shrimp, fresh vegetables, and tangy dressing for a mix of crunchy and zesty flavors.

thai_script: สลัดปูนิ่ม
description: A vibrant salad featuring deep-fried soft-shell crab served with fresh greens, herbs, and a light, tangy dressing.

thai_script: สะเต๊ะ
description: Marinated beef, chicken, or pork grilled on bamboo skewers and usually served with nam chim sate (peanut sauce) and achat (pickled cucumber).

thai_script: สังขยาฟักทอง
description: Steamed pumpkin with an egg-and-coconut custard filling, similar to the coconut jam from Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines.

thai_script: สาคูถั่วดำ
description: Tapioca pearls and black beans (one of the vigna cultivars) with sweetened coconut milk and the flesh of a young coconut.

thai_script: สาคูไส้หมู
description: In Thailand tapioca balls with pork filling are call sakhu sai mu . Sakhu sai mu is a kind of snack which is very famous in Thailand and found at street stalls and markets. It is a dumpling which consists of a flour ball with a pork filling. Most people in Thailand eat it with khao kriap pak mo .

thai_script: สามชั้นทอดน้ำปลา
english_name: Fried Pork Belly with Fish Sauce
description: Crispy pork belly deep-fried until golden and seasoned with fish sauce for a salty, savory flavor.

thai_script: สามชั้นผัดกะปิ
english_name: Pork Belly Stir-fried with Shrimp Paste
description: Rich pork belly stir-fried with aromatic shrimp paste, chili, and herbs, giving it a bold and pungent taste.

thai_script: สาโท
description: A traditional rice wine from the Isan region.

thai_script: สุกี้
description: A Thai variant of the Chinese hot pot , it is mainly eaten as a meal on its own.

thai_script: ส้มตำ
description: Som tam which contains peanuts, is the Central Thai dish that became famous internationally

thai_script: ส้มตำปู
description: Green papaya salad with brined rice paddy crabs.

thai_script: ส้มตำไข่เค็ม
description: A variation of the standard papaya som tam with salted eggs.

thai_script: ส้าเนื้อ
description: A northern Thai speciality, made with blanched medium rare, thinly sliced beef. Other ingredients for this dish are the elaborate phrik lap Lanna spices-and-chilli mix, onions, some broth, and fresh herbs.

thai_script: ส้าเนื้อสะดุ้ง
description: A northern Thai speciality, made with sauteed medium rare, thinly sliced beef. Other ingredients for this dish are the elaborate phrik lap Lanna spices-and-chili mix, onions, some broth, and fresh herbs such as kraphao (holy basil) or phak phai ( Vietnamese coriander ) although this particular version was made using saranae ( spearmint ). This particular version also contained nam phia , the partially digested contents from the first of the four stomachs of cattle, for added flavour. [ 5 ]

thai_script: หนังไก่ทอด
description: Crispy, deep-fried chicken skin that can be eaten as a snack or together with chili pastes or salads.

thai_script: หน่อยัดไส้ทอด
description: A northern Thai speciality of deep-fried bamboo shoots with a filling of minced pork.

thai_script: หน่อไม้ฝรั่งผัดกุ้ง
description: Green asparagus stir-fried with prawns, garlic, sliced chili peppers, fish sauce, and oyster sauce.

thai_script: หมี่กรอบ
description: Deep fried rice vermicelli with a sweet and sour sauce.

thai_script: หมึกกรุบ
description: Konjac snack with spicy flavor.

thai_script: หมูกรอบ
description: Cooked belly pork is first marinated and then deep fried until crispy. Often used sliced in vegetables stir fries.

thai_script: หมูกรอบผัดผงกะหรี่
english_name: Crispy Pork Stir-fried with Curry Powder
description: Crispy pork belly stir-fried with curry powder, onions, and peppers, creating a fragrant and savory dish.

thai_script: หมูกรอบคั่วพริกเกลือ
english_name: Crispy Pork with Chili and Salt
description: Golden crispy pork belly wok-fried with garlic, chili, and salt for a spicy, aromatic, and crunchy flavor.

thai_script: หมูกรอบผัดกะเพรา
english_name: Stir-fried holy basil with crispy pork
description: Slices of crispy grilled pork are stirred-fried with holy basil. This particular version is served with khai dao (fried egg) which had the egg yolk removed before frying and then added on later.

thai_script: หมูกระทะ
description: Mu kratha resembles a combination of a Korean barbecue and a Chinese hot pot . Meat (most often pork) is grilled in the center while the vegetables and other ingredients, such as fish balls , cook in the soup. It is served with a variety of nam chim (Thai dipping sauces).

thai_script: หมูทอดกระเทียม
description: Deep-fried pork and garlic

thai_script: หมูน้ำตก
description: A very spicy salad made with pork ( mu ) and somewhat identical to lap , except that the meat is cut into thin strips rather than minced.

thai_script: หมูผัดสะตอ
description: Sliced pork stir-fried with sato (the beans of the Parkia speciosa , also known as "stink bean" or "bitter bean"), onion, garlic, fish sauce, chili peppers, and oyster sauce.

thai_script: หมูผัดสะตอภาคใต้
description: A spicy, southern Thai, version of mu phat sato where the pork and "stink beans" are fried with a copious amount of chili peppers and chili paste.

thai_script: หมูมะนาว
description: Sliced grilled pork with a dressing ( nam chim ) of mashed garlic, green bird's eye chili peppers, sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice. Here it is served with additional sliced bird's eye chili peppers and raw garlic on a bed of ice-water chilled sliced raw phak khana (Chinese broccoli)

thai_script: หมูย่าง
description: Originally from the Isan region of Thailand, the fatty parts of belly pork, together with the skin, are preferred over lean meat. It is served with nam chim chaeo , a spicy dipping sauce made with dried chili peppers, and roasted sticky rice.

thai_script: หมูย่างจิ้มแจ่ว
english_name: Grilled Pork with Jaew Dipping Sauce
description: Slices of marinated grilled pork served with jaew, a smoky and spicy dipping sauce made from roasted chili and tamarind.

thai_script: หมูรวมลวกจิ้ม
description: This dish consist of several types of pork (intestines, liver, and other cuts) which have been shortly blanched in boiling water or stock and then served with fried garlic, spring onions and a spicy dipping sauce.

thai_script: หมูหวาน
description: Sliced pork is simmered or fried with sugar and soy sauce until the sauce is reduced and coats the meat.

thai_script: หมูแดดเดียว
description: Deep-fried strips of sun dried pork, here with sesame seeds. A spicy dipping sauce (very often Sriracha sauce) is almost always provided with this dish.

thai_script: หม้อใหญ่
description: A large serving of Thai-style hotpot, typically filled with broth, meat, seafood, and vegetables for sharing.

thai_script: หลนหน่อไม้กุ้ง
english_name: Fermented Bamboo Shoot Dip with Shrimp
description: A creamy and savory dip made from shrimp and bamboo shoots simmered in coconut milk, served with fresh vegetables.

thai_script: หลนเห็ด
description: A vegetarian dip made with assorted mushrooms cooked in coconut milk and herbs, served with raw vegetables.

thai_script: ห่อหมกทะเล
description: A traditional Thai dish of mixed seafood steamed with red curry paste and coconut milk in banana leaf cups.

thai_script: หม้อกลาง
description: A medium-sized Thai hotpot portion, served with broth, meat, or seafood and vegetables.

thai_script: หม้อเล็ก
description: A small portion of Thai-style hotpot, suitable for one or two people, served with soup and sides.

thai_script: ห่อหมกปลา
description: A Thai steamed curry with fish, spices, coconut milk, and egg, steam-cooked in a banana leaf cup and topped with thick coconut cream before serving.

thai_script: ห่อหมกมะพร้าวอ่อน
description: A Thai steamed curry with mixed seafood and the soft meat of a young coconut, here served inside a coconut.

thai_script: ออส่วน
description: A crispy and chewy omelet made with oysters and starch batter, often served sizzling with bean sprouts.

thai_script: เกาเหลา
description: A soup of Chinese origin, usually containing offal, often pork liver and intestines, also boiled eggs, and other meats such as crispy pork. Alternatively, at regular noodle soup shops, it can also be as a regular Thai-Chinese noodle soup but then served without any noodles.

thai_script: เขียวหวานทะเลแห้ง
description: A drier version of green curry stir-fried with assorted seafood, herbs, and curry paste for an intense flavor.

thai_script: เขียวหวาน
description: A creamy and aromatic curry made with green chili paste, coconut milk, meat or seafood, and Thai herbs.

thai_script: เฉาก๊วย
description: Grass jelly is made from a herb from the mint family. It is often served with only shaved ice and brown sugar.

thai_name: Tao Hu Khai Pad Phong Karee
thai_script: เต้าหู้ไข่ผัดผงกะหรี่
english_name: Stir-fried Egg Tofu with Curry Powder
description: Golden egg tofu stir-fried with curry powder, vegetables, and sometimes seafood, offering a rich and aromatic flavor.

thai_script: เต้าหู้ทรงเครื่อง
description: Soft tofu topped with minced pork, mushrooms, and vegetables, simmered in a flavorful sauce.

thai_script: เนื้อทุบ
description: Beef is pounded after grilling, and served with a chili dip.

thai_script: เนื้อปิ้ง
description: Marinated and barbecued beef.

thai_script: เนื้อผัดใบยี่หร่า
description: Besides beef and basil, other ingredients are garlic, chili peppers, light soy sauce, and fish sauce. African basil leaves have a slight anise taste.

thai_script: เนื้อย่างน้ำตก
description: With a similar "dressing" as larb , this dish is made with sliced grilled beef. "Nam tok" means "waterfall" in Thai and it is thought that the meat juices should run out from the meat like a waterfall.

thai_script: เนื้อเค็มทอด
description: Salted and sun-dried beef that has been deep-fried before serving.

thai_script: เนื้อแดดเดียวกะเพราทอด
description: Deep-fried strips of sun dried beef and with crispy fried holy basil .

thai_script: เฟรนฟราย
description: Deep-fried potato sticks, crispy on the outside and fluffy inside, served as a popular snack or side dish.

thai_script: เมี่ยงคำ
description: Dried shrimp and other ingredients wrapped in cha phlu (Thai: ชะพลู) leaves.

thai_script: เมี่ยงปลา
description: Similar to Miang kham, the main ingredient for this wrap is deep-fried fish. Deep-fried fish with other ingredients wrapped in cha phlu leaves

thai_script: เยื่อไผ่ตุ๋นน้ำแดง
description: A nourishing Chinese-influenced soup made with bamboo pith stewed in a savory red broth with vegetables and seasonings.

thai_script: เย็นตาโฟ
description: The Thai version of the Chinese noodle dish Yong Tau Foo is slightly sweet, sour, salty, and spicy.

thai_script: เล้งซุปเปอร์
description: A fiery and tangy soup made from pork spine bones simmered with lime juice, chilies, and herbs, known for its bold and zesty flavor.

thai_script: เล้งแซ่บ
description: Spicy and sour pork spine soup.

thai_script: เสือร้องไห้
description: Suea rong hai literally means "weeping tiger". It is grilled marinated beef which is eaten with vegetables and Nam chim chaeo dipping sauce.

thai_script: เหล้าขาว
description: A distilled alcohol made from Thai rice , it is often a home-made moonshine .

thai_script: เหล้าแม่โขง
