description: Closer to a rum, it is distilled from sugarcane and rice.

thai_script: เห็ดเป๋าฮื้อผัดกุ้ง
description: A light and savory stir-fry of abalone mushrooms and shrimp, cooked with garlic and oyster sauce for a delicate flavor.

thai_script: เห็ดเป๋าฮื้อเจี้ยนคะน้า
description: Tender abalone mushrooms simmered with crisp kale in a flavorful sauce, balancing earthy and slightly bitter notes.

thai_script: แกงกระด้าง
description: A pork curry aspic (jelly) from northern Thailand which is eaten cold.

thai_script: แกงกะหรี่
description: It is a Thai-Muslim dish which is mostly known in the West as "Thai yellow curry". It is of Indian origin and is often made with chicken and potatoes. It can also be made with other meats or seafood.

thai_script: แกงขนุน
description: A northern Thai curry made with boiled whole jackfruit , pork, tomatoes, and chopped chakhan ( Piper interruptum ; "pepper vine").

thai_script: แกงขี้เหล็ก
description: This creamy curry has as its main ingredient the leaves and flower buds of the Senna siamea tree ( khilek in Thai).

thai_script: แกงคั่ว
description: A type of Thai curry which uses a larger amount of turmeric in the paste than is usually the norm. A popular preparation is with prawns and pineapple. This particular version is called kaeng khua het fang ( Thai : แกงคั่วเห็ดฟาง ): with straw mushrooms .

thai_script: แกงคั่วหมูใบชะมวง
description: A thick central Thai curry with pork and the leaves of chamuang or Garcinia cowa , a tree related to the mangosteen .

thai_script: แกงจืด
description: A light vegetable, chicken or pork broth with vegetables and celery, to which minced pork, soft tofu, seaweed, glass noodles , and mushroom can be added. This soup can also be called Kaeng chuet ( Thai : แกงจืดวุ้นเส้น ).

thai_script: แกงชะอม
description: A northern Thai curry with cha-om (the young leaves of the Acacia pennata ) and dried fish. This particular version also contained a mix of different types of mushroom.

thai_script: แกงดอกสะแล
description: A northern Thai curry that is made from the unopened flower buds of the shrub Broussonetia kurzii (J. D. Hooker) Corner. These flower buds are available in northern Thailand only from mid-February until late March.

thai_script: แกงตูน
description: A northern Thai curry made with the stalks of the Leucocasia gigantea and catfish. Leucocasia gigantea is called tun ( Thai : ตูน ) in the northern Thai language and khun ( Thai : คูน ) in standard Thai.

thai_script: แกงปลาแรดใบยอ
english_name: Curry with Giant Gourami and Moringa Leaves
description: A spicy Thai curry made with giant gourami fish and moringa leaves, combining rich herbal notes with a slightly bitter undertone.

thai_script: แกงปลี
description: A northern Thai curry made with chopped banana flower and pork.

thai_script: แกงป่า
description: Traditionally made with wild boar , most often pork or chicken is used nowadays. This curry, as most curries from northern Thailand, does not contain coconut milk.

thai_script: แกงป่าปลาคัง
description: A spicy, herb-filled jungle curry cooked without coconut milk, featuring catfish and assorted Thai vegetables

thai_script: แกงป่าปลาแรด
english_name: Jungle Curry with Pla Rad (Giant Gourami)
description: A fiery jungle curry made with giant gourami, fresh herbs, and vegetables, known for its intense heat and earthy flavors.

thai_script: แกงป่าหมูป่า
description: A bold and spicy jungle curry featuring wild boar meat, chili, and Thai herbs, offering a rustic and gamey flavor.

thai_name: Kaeng phak kat cho kraduk mu
thai_script: แกงผักกาดจอกระดูกหมู
english_name: Kaeng phak kat cho kraduk mu
description: A somewhat spicy soup/curry ( kaeng ) made with cabbage ( phak kat cho , a variety of Brassica rapa chinensis ) and pork ribs ( kraduk mu ). As is usual with Northern Thai "curries", it does not contain any coconut milk.

thai_script: แกงผักบุ้งใส่ปลา
description: A northern Thai curry made with " morning glory " and catfish.

thai_script: แกงผักหวานป่า
description: A Northern Thai curry made with the leaves of the woody plant Melientha suavis Pierre, glass noodles, and dried fish.

thai_script: แกงผักเซียงดา
description: A northern Thai curry made with the leaves of the vine Gymnema inodorum and dried fish. In this particular version, snakehead fish is used.

thai_script: แกงผักเลือด
description: A northern Thai curry made with the leaves of the Ficus virens . This version is with pork.

thai_script: แกงพะแนง
description: A so-called dry, Malay influenced coconut curry with beef ( phanaeng nuea , Thai : พะแนงเนื้อ ), chicken, pork or seafood such as soft shell crab.

thai_script: แกงฟักใส่ไก่
description: A northern Thai curry made with winter melon and chicken. It is also known under the name kaeng fak khio .

thai_script: แกงมัสมั่น
description: A rich, thick curry containing coconut milk, usually of stewed beef or, as in the image, chicken. This curry contains roasted dried spices that are rarely found in other Thai curries. The name kaeng matsaman means "Muslim curry", with the spices believed to have been brought to Thailand by Muslim traders in the 17th century. Massaman curry is usually served with rice or roti.

thai_name: Kaeng yot maphrao on sai kai
thai_script: แกงยอดมะพร้าวอ่อนใส่ไก่
english_name: Kaeng yot maphrao on sai kai
description: A northern Thai curry made with " coconut heart " and chicken. The taste of "coconut heart" is similar to bamboo shoots but much sweeter.

thai_script: แกงรัญจวน
description: Kaeng ranchuan is a beef curry and fermented shrimp paste chili sauce, similar to tom yam . It was created by chef in royal households from the leftovers and turned in new dish by combining pieces of meat and leftover sauce especially nam phrik kapi . The most popular of all dip is nam phrik kapi , a very delicious sauce of Thailand because this sauce can be eaten with everything. Many Thai chefs reformed kaeng ranchuan to restaurants after it was mentioned by culinary authority ML Nueang Ninrat, in a memoir explaining her life during the reign of King Rama V and VI. The people misunderstand about the origin and preparation of kaeng ranchuan because of famous TV series that do the wrong method of this dish and make people remember that this is the real kaeng ranchuan preparation method. So, the real kaeng ranchuan is in ML Ninrat book "Life in the Palace" she tells how her grandmother, the princess Sabai Ninrat created this dish. At the end of dinner there was leftovers so she asked her assistant to separate the meat from chili and basil. Then, she mixed it into a broth and added leftover of Nam prhrik kapi, so this is called the real kaeng ranchuan .

thai_script: แกงส้ม
description: A hot and sour Thai curry/soup made with tamarind paste and fish (often pla chon [" Snakehead fish "]). Kaeng som cha-om thot ( Thai : แกงส้มชะอมทอด ) is a version of the dish which features deep-fried cha-om (Acacia leaves) as one of its ingredients.

thai_name: Gaeng Som Khai Thot Bai Yor Goong
thai_script: แกงส้มไข่ทอดใบยอกุ้ง
english_name: Sour Curry with Fried Moringa Leaf Omelette and Shrimp
description: A tangy Southern-style sour curry made with shrimp and pieces of fried moringa leaf omelette simmered in a spicy, tamarind-based broth.

thai_script: แกงหยวก
description: A northern Thai curry made with the tender core of the trunk of the banana plant.

thai_script: แกงอ่อม
description: A spicy Lanna "curry" with meat, and without any coconut milk. The version shown in the photo is with beef.

thai_script: แกงฮังเล
description: A Burmese influenced curry of stewed meat (usually pork), peanuts, dried chili peppers and tamarind juice but without coconut milk. Thin strips of fresh ginger are added in before serving.

thai_script: แกงเขียวหวาน
description: A coconut curry made with fresh green chili peppers and flavored with Thai basil, usually with chicken ( kaeng khiao wan kai ) or fish balls .

thai_script: แกงเทโพ
description: One of the dishes mentioned in the poem of King Rama II on Thai dishes, it is a central Thai curry originally made with the fatty belly part of the Pangasius Larnaudii ( thae pho ; shark catfish) but now more often belly pork is used as is the case with the version shown in the photo. The other main ingredient in this curry is phak bung Chin (Chinese water spinach ).

thai_script: แกงเผ็ด
description: A spicy red curry made with dried chili peppers, containing coconut milk. It can be made with different meats, seafood or tofu, in combination with (several types of) eggplant(s), and sometimes other vegetables. Fresh green peppercorns and Thai basil are often added to enhance the flavor.

thai_script: แกงเผ็ดเป็ดย่าง
description: Red curry with roast duck is the quintessential mix of the Thai (red curry) and Chinese (red roast duck) cuisines. This dish often also contains grapes and pineapple.

thai_script: แกงเหลือง
description: A sour spicy curry that does not contain coconut milk and is yellow in color due to the use of turmeric , often with fish and vegetables, such as bamboo shoots as in the version in the photo. In southern Thailand it is called kaeng som but due to it being different from the central Thai kaeng som , it is called kaeng lueang ("yellow curry") elsewhere. It should not be confused with what is known as " yellow curry " outside of Thailand.

thai_script: แกงเห็ด
description: A northern Thai curry made with pork and a variety of mushrooms.

thai_script: แกงแค
description: A spicy curry of herbs, vegetables, cha-om leaves (a kind of acacia tree), and meat (chicken, water buffalo, pork, or frog meat). It does not contain any coconut milk.

thai_script: แกงโฮะ
description: A Northern Thai dish where one or more types of curry are refried with glass noodles and other ingredients such as kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass, and bamboo shoots. At least one of the curries used in this recipe should be the Northern Thai pork curry called kaeng hangle .

thai_script: แกงไตปลา
description: A thick, spicy vegetable curry made with turmeric, a sauce made from fish innards ( tai pla ), and shrimp paste, containing roasted fish, bamboo shoots, and eggplant.

thai_script: แคบหมู
description: Deep fried pork skin that is eaten with nam phrik num (grilled green chili dip) from Chiang Mai is renowned in the whole of Thailand.

thai_script: แซ่บกุ้ง
description: A fiery and tangy Thai salad made with shrimp, fresh herbs, chili, and lime juice for a bold flavor.

thai_script: แป้งนมย่างอมเนื้อ
description: Grilled cow udders, served with a chili dip.

thai_script: แสงโสม
description: A Thai rum which has been distilled since 1977.

thai_script: แหนมคลุก
description: Naem sausage (pork fermented with sticky rice) [ 4 ] is mixed with boiled rice and then deep-fried. The salad is made by crumbling the deep-fried balls and mixing in sliced shallots, dried chillies, fish sauce and lime juice. It is served with raw vegetables and herbs.

thai_script: แอ็บปลาน้อย
description: Freshwater small fry and brine shrimp are mixed with curry paste and then grilled over a low fire wrapped inside banana leaves.

thai_script: แอ็บหมู
description: A Northern Thai " soufflé " of egg, minced pork, herbs, and curry paste that is slowly grilled inside a banana leaf wrapper over a charcoal fire.

thai_script: แอ็บอ่องออ
description: Roughly chopped pig's brain mixed with egg and curry paste are grilled over a low fire, wrapped inside banana leaves.

thai_script: โจ๊ก
description: Of Chinese origin, it is a rice congee with minced chicken or pork. Mixing an egg in with the congee is optional.

thai_script: โรตี
description: In Thailand, Roti is eaten primarily with Southern Thai curries. It is also a popular street food dessert that is topped with sweetened condensed milk.

thai_script: โรตีกล้วย
description: Sliced banana and beaten eggs are fried inside a thin sheet of dough, then cut and served with sweetened condensed milk or sugar.

thai_script: โรตีสายไหม
description: An extremely sweet kind of cotton candy which is wrapped inside small, thin pancakes.

thai_script: โอเลี้ยง
description: A sweet Thai black ice coffee . The name is of Teochew origin where "o" means black, and "liang" means cold.

thai_script: ใบปอ
description: Eaten blanched as a dish with khao tom kui (plain rice congee ), the taste is similar to that of spinach or samphire .

thai_script: ไก่ครีมมะนาว
description: Tender pieces of chicken cooked in a creamy lemon sauce, combining richness with a refreshing citrus tang.

thai_script: ไก่ตุ๋นยาจีน
description: The name literally translates to "chicken stewed with Chinese medicine". It contains medicinal herbs, one of them the dried fruit of the wolfberry , a.k.a. goji berries ( Thai : เก๋ากี้ ; kaoki ). The dish is of Chinese origin.

thai_script: ไก่ทอด
description: The version of kai thot as shown in the image is made in the Southern Thai manner, having been marinated with khamin ( turmeric ) and served with krueng thae (crispy fried chopped garlic and turmeric) as a topping.

thai_script: ไก่ทอดตะไคร้
description: Pieces of chicken are deep fried together with finely chopped or shredded lemongrass, and served with a sweet chili sauce.

thai_script: ไก่ผัดขิง
description: A simple dish of fried slices of chicken with sliced ginger, soy sauce, fish sauce, and chili peppers.

thai_script: ไก่ผัดเม็ดมะม่วง
description: A savory stir-fry of chicken, cashew nuts, and vegetables in a sweet and slightly spicy sauce.

thai_script: ไก่ผัดเม็ดมะม่วงหิมพานต์
description: The Thai Chinese version of the Sichuan style fried chicken with cashew nuts known as Kung Pao chicken , stir-fried with whole dried chili peppers.

thai_script: ไก่ย่าง
description: Grilled marinated chicken, usually eaten together with Som tam (papaya salad).

thai_script: ไก่รมควัน
description: Smoked chicken is often eaten as a snack to go with drinks.

thai_script: ไก่ห่อใบเตย
description: Pieces of marinated chicken are wrapped in fragrant pandan leaves and then deep fried. [ 2 ]

thai_script: ไข่ดาว
description: Literally translated khai dao means "star egg", referring to the star-like shape of the egg after it has been fried. Traditionally the egg is fried in large amounts of hot vegetable oil which produces a crispy outer texture. Khai dao mai suk is a fried egg where the yolk is still runny, the way it is most commonly eaten when served with, for instance, khao phat ("fried rice") or kaphrao mu rat khao ("pork fried with holy basil served with rice"). Fried egg with a (very) hard yolk, khai dao suk (mak) , is needed when the fried egg is used for making yam khai dao : fried egg salad.

thai_script: ไข่พะโล้
description: Egg stewed with meat in soy sauce, garlic, ginger and phong phalo ( Thai : ผงพะโล้ ; five-spice powder ). Meats used in khai phalo tend to be pork (belly or trotter) or chicken wings. Other ingredients, such as mushrooms and fried tofu, can also be incorporated. The dish is of Chinese origin. Similar dishes are mu phalo and kha mu phalo (using only pork, and ham hocks), kai phalo (chicken) and pet phalo (duck).

thai_script: ไข่ยัดไส้
description: An omelette is fried filled with various ingredients of choice (minced beef or pork, prawns, and vegetables) and then folded over.

thai_script: ไข่ลูกเขย
description: Boiled eggs are (deep-)fried until crispy on the outside, and then served sliced with a tangy sauce made from tamarind juice. The Thai name literally translates as "son-in-law eggs".

thai_script: ไข่เจียวกุ้ง
description: A fluffy Thai omelet filled with shrimp, giving it a sweet and savory seafood flavor.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวปู
description: A rich Thai omelet stuffed with fresh crab meat, often served with rice and chili sauce.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวหมูสับ
description: A classic Thai omelet mixed with minced pork, crispy on the outside and soft inside.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวหอยนางรม
description: A Thai-style omelet fried with fresh oysters, resulting in a rich and slightly briny flavor.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวแหนม
description: A crispy Thai omelet cooked with pieces of tangy fermented pork for a savory, aromatic flavor.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวใบยอ
description: A Thai-style omelet mixed with chopped moringa leaves, giving it a fragrant and slightly bitter flavor.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวไข่มดแดง
description: A Thai-style crispy-fried omelette which includes the eggs of the red ant.

thai_script: ไข่เจียวไส้
description: A stuffed omelette is a savory dish of beaten eggs cooked in a pan, then filled with a variety of ingredients before being folded over.

thai_name: Pad Kra Pao Khai Yiew Ma
thai_script: ไข่เยี่ยวม้ากะเพรากรอบ
english_name: Stir Fried Minced Pork with Century Eggs
description: Stir-Fried Minced Pork with Century Eggs is a spicy Thai dish made with minced pork, garlic, chilies, and holy basil, then topped with wedges of creamy, pungent century eggs. The rich eggs balance the heat and savory pork, creating a bold mix of textures and flavors.

thai_script: ไส้กรอกอีสาน
description: Grilled, fermented pork and sticky rice sausage, originally from the Isan region of Thailand. It can be shaped like a sausage as in the image, or as round balls . It is also often eaten as a snack at festivals and fairs, and served together with sliced ginger, bird's eye chili peppers, and raw cabbage.

thai_script: ไส้หมูทอด
description: Deep-fried pork intestines

thai_script: ไส้หมูปิ้ง
description: Marinated and barbecued pork intestines.

thai_script: ไส้อั่ว
description: A grilled sausage of ground pork mixed with spices and herbs, and which is often served with chopped fresh ginger and chili peppers at a meal.
